page.title: 06Chipping Sodbury Common.
page.content: Chipping Sodbury Common used to be all bushes in the 1930's before the war. But then it was turned into farm land for growing cereal crops,because of the need for food during the war.Cows graze on the Common from 31st of May - 31st November.You find Friesian cows, hefiers young cows, and bullocks.The golf course was put on the Common just after the war.The holes on the golf course have been fenced off because the cows graze by the holes,and the golfers have to climb over the fence. There is not much housing on the common.On the Common it is mostly farm houses.There is a lot of dairy farming on the Common.People use the Common for outdoor recreation such as walking picnics,riding and jogging.The common is mis-used by some people as they dump or leave household rubbish.
